definition: Hong Kong, abbr. for 香港[Xiang1 gang3]/surname Gang

sentences.english: It's turned that job over to the Gulf Coast Claims Facility, or GCCF.
sentences.chinese: 索赔工作将由港湾海岸索赔机构GCCF接管。

sentences.english: Be anchored in the bay where all men ride.
sentences.chinese: 才在人尽可泊的港湾里抛锚。

sentences.english: The boat ferried passengers across the bay.
The coastal lines of Aegean Sea are long and winding where scatters with many gulf and dotted with numerous and island.
sentences.chinese: 爱琴海的海岸线非常曲折，港湾众多，岛屿星罗棋布。

sentences.english: Harbor Messenger doesn't come out until Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 《港湾先驱报》要到星期四才出。

sentences.english: Can you find a guide to pilot the boat into the little harbour?
sentences.chinese: 你能找位领航员将船引进这个小港湾吗？

sentences.english: They began rowing towards the harbour's mouth.
sentences.chinese: 他们开始划向港湾的入口处。

sentences.english: Weekend with the wife to drive to the blue harbor two people walk around.
sentences.chinese: 周末跟媳妇两个人开车去蓝色港湾转转。

sentences.english: There are many bay-drowned-valley tidal inlets and Sandbar-lagoon tidal inlets in Hainan island.
sentences.chinese: 海南岛存在着大量港湾溺谷型和砂坝泻湖型潮汐汊道。

sentences.english: The picture shows Wang Guoqiang "Green Harbour" visit the children.
sentences.chinese: 图为王国强在“绿色港湾”看望孩子们。

sentences.english: It has 22 deep ports where ten-thousand-ton docks can be built.
sentences.chinese: 较大港湾22处，可建万吨深水港口。

sentences.english: This flexibility allows the statue to sway in the harbor winds.
sentences.chinese: 这使雕像具有能够在港湾中随风摇摆的灵活性。

sentences.english: He took up the pole and shoved the boat off.
sentences.chinese: 他们用篙把船撑出挤满船的港湾。

sentences.english: Group of Chinese harbour construction hangs out his shingle formally hold water already two years many.
sentences.chinese: 中国港湾建设集团正式挂牌成立已经两年多了。

sentences.english: A boat in the harbor will eventually rot out.
sentences.chinese: 不离开港湾的船将最终会腐烂的。

sentences.english: One is a federal-level tourist resort, "Baikal harbor."
sentences.chinese: 其中一个是属于联邦级旅游度假区“贝加尔港湾”。

definition: to travel a great distance by sea or air/voyage/long-haul flight
(of a boat) to reach the shore/to pull toward shore/close to shore/landfall
to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
to give shelter from the wind and rain/to keep out the elements
